revised_title: Anatomy and Physiology of Walrus and Seal: Curious Facts and Analogy in Structure
tldr: Sir Everard Home discusses the similarities in the hind foot structure of walruses and flies, the unique bile collection and release mechanism in walruses, and the uncoiled umbilical vessels and placenta structure in seals. These findings contribute to the understanding of the anatomy and physiology of these marine mammals.
